item.description:
@coalman58 wrote:

Very nice I’m using now but I got one problem. The click here to play button doesnt show. Maybe I copied something wrong but every thing else shows except the click here to play button. I know it isn’t necessary cause you can just click on the mini map but it makes it look better so could you please help me?

any idea how to fix i really wanna add the interface btw im using bluurrs client by shkic (shkick is from rune-serv…)[/quote]

Look through other topics I posted on how to increse the interface size.

item.title: [Non-Renamed] Simple Welcome Screen
item.dc:creator: @Tonic Tonic
item.description:
@Tonic wrote:

[quote=“thewtfclan, post:14, topic:308366”][quote author=eld0002 link=topic=404715.msg2994887#msg2994887 date=1255521298]

Class9.java:1519: addSprite(int,int,int,java.lang.String) is already defined in
Class9
public static void addSprite(int i, int j, int k, String spriteName)
^
Class9.java:1535: addCloseButton(int,java.lang.String,int,int,java.lang.String)
is already defined in Class9
public static void addCloseButton(int i, String spriteName, int width, int heigh
t, String s)
^
Class9.java:1552: addActionButton(int,int,int,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
is already defined in Class9
public static void addActionButton(int i, int width, int height, String s, Strin
g spriteName)
^
Class9.java:5039: CustomSpriteLoader(int,java.lang.String) is already defined in
Class9
private static Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 CustomSpriteLoader(int i, String s)
^
Class9.java:5184: loadAscheriitSprite(int,java.lang.String) is already defined i
n Class9
private static Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 loadAscheriitSprite(int i, String s)
^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
5 errors
Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .

You’ve got multiple Methods, Delete 1 of Each of the ones in the Line Example you have 2
public static void addSprite(int i, int j, boolean bool, String s, String s2, int x, int y) {
Class9 sprite = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
sprite.anInt250 = i;
sprite.anInt236 = i;
sprite.anInt262 = 5;
sprite.anInt217 = bool ? 1 : 0;
sprite.anInt214 = 0;
sprite.anInt220 = x;
sprite.anInt267 = y;
sprite.aByte254 = 0;
sprite.anInt230 = -1;
sprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = loadSprite(j, s);
sprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = loadSprite(j, s);
if(bool) {
sprite.aString221 = s2;
}
}
public static void addSprite(int i, int j, boolean bool, String s, String s2, int x, int y) {
Class9 sprite = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
sprite.anInt250 = i;
sprite.anInt236 = i;
sprite.anInt262 = 5;
sprite.anInt217 = bool ? 1 : 0;
sprite.anInt214 = 0;
sprite.anInt220 = x;
sprite.anInt267 = y;
sprite.aByte254 = 0;
sprite.anInt230 = -1;
sprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = loadSprite(j, s);
sprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = loadSprite(j, s);
if(bool) {
sprite.aString221 = s2;
}
}

Delete 1 you get:
public static void addSprite(int i, int j, boolean bool, String s, String s2, int x, int y) {
Class9 sprite = aClass9Array210[i] = new Class9();
sprite.anInt250 = i;
sprite.anInt236 = i;
sprite.anInt262 = 5;
sprite.anInt217 = bool ? 1 : 0;
sprite.anInt214 = 0;
sprite.anInt220 = x;
sprite.anInt267 = y;
sprite.aByte254 = 0;
sprite.anInt230 = -1;
sprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_207 = loadSprite(j, s);
sprite.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1_260 = loadSprite(j, s);
if(bool) {
sprite.aString221 = s2;
}
}

There Do that for each of the methods you wrote and your done

[/quote]
idk what y saying ;s[/quote]

Hes saying you have multiples of the same method, you only need 1 of each.
